name: Wilderness Chase Complications
description: At the end of each round during a chase through wilderness, roll a d20 for each participant to determine if a complication occurs. A result of 1-10 means no complication.

complications.effect: No additional effect this round.

The ground is uneven with roots and rocks. DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall Prone.
A patch of thorns or briars blocks the path. DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 Piercing damage. The brambles count as 5 feet of Difficult Terrain whether or not the save succeeds.
A stream or creek crosses the path. DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check to cross. On failure, the stream counts as 10 feet of Difficult Terrain.
Thick bushes and foliage block the way. DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check to push through. On failure, the area counts as 15 feet of Difficult Terrain.
A sudden drop of 1d4 x 5 feet. DC 10 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to jump across or scramble down and up. On failure, fall and take 1d6 Bludgeoning damage per 10 feet fallen.
A herd of animals stampedes through the area. DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 Bludgeoning damage and be knocked Prone.
Low branches threaten to clothesline runners. DC 10 Dexterity saving throw. On failure, take 1d6 Bludgeoning damage and spend 5 extra feet of movement.
The ground becomes muddy and waterlogged. DC 12 Constitution saving throw or your speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of your next turn.
A concealed hole in the ground. DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice it, or DC 12 Dexterity saving throw to avoid falling in. On failure, fall 1d4 x 5 feet and take appropriate falling damage.
A sheer drop or very steep incline appears ahead. DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check to navigate safely. On failure, slide or fall 2d6 x 5 feet, taking 1d6 Bludgeoning damage per 10 feet.
